In this task, you are presented with the most probable words of a topic (in the left panel of the screen), ordered in the decreased order of their probability. You are requested to provide quantitative and qualitative feedback on the quality of a topic.
You will be shown a set of statements related to the quality of the topic.
You need to provide how much you agree with each statement in the context of the topic on a scale of "Strong Disagreement" to "Strong Agreement".
You also need to provide a label for the topic and rationale behind your agreement with the statements.
You are requested to provide the above inputs for multiple topics.
These topics are inferred on the corpus of the bound and daily editions of the United States Congressional Record. The corpus includes all text spoken on the floor of each chamber of Congress: the United States House of Representatives and the United States Senate. In this study we focus on the 114th session of Congress (2015-2017).
You may come across content that may be offensive or distressing. You can withdraw from the study by using "Exit" option at the bottom of the page.
You can use the left arrow to move backward and use the right arrow to move forward.
